Patent Information.Patent Title: Apidaecin-type peptide antibiotics with improved activities and/or different antibacterial spectrum.
Patent Information.Abstract: This invention provides a purified polypeptide having antibacterial activity comprising a first sequence Pro-Arg-Pro-Pro-His-Pro-Arg-X1, wherein X1 is Ile or Leu; and a second sequence X2-Pro-X3-X4-X5-Pro, wherein X2 is Arg or Lys, X3 is Thr, Gln or Arg, X4 is Tyr, Gln or Pro, and X5 is Val or Ala, the second sequence is N-terminal to the first sequence. This invention also provides a purified polypeptide having antibacterial activity comprising: a first sequence, at least seven amino acid residues are the same as Pro-Arg-Pro-Pro-His-Pro-Arg-X1, wherein X1 is Ile or Leu; a second sequence X2-Pro-X3-X4X5-Pro, wherein X2 is Arg or Lys, X3 is Thr, Gln or Arg, X4 is Tyr, Gln or Pro, and X5 is Val or Ala, the second sequence is N-terminal to the first sequence; and a third sequence comprising at least five amino acid residues, at least one-third of the residues are Pro, the third sequence is N-terminal to the second sequence.

Sequence Information.Target Organism: No MICs found in DRAMP database
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: The NMR data clearly indicate a difference between the glycosylated and nonglycosylated forms, i.e., in the perturbation of a turn directly adjacent to the glycosylation site.
Sequence Information.Function: Antibacterial peptide with strong anti-Gram-negative bacteria activity.
Sequence Information.PTM: O-glycosylation is essential for full biological activity.
Sequence Information.Tissue specificity: In hemolymph 6 hours after immune challenge, levels of expression increase for first 24 hours and persist for the following two weeks.
Sequence Information.Developmental stage: Expressed in larvae and in adults.
